intro: [WRONG START] Gelonomium borbonicum, commonly known as the Bourbon geranium, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically features serrated leaves and produces vibrant blooms in shades of pink, red, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value and adaptability contribute to its widespread cultivation.
